intro: Aspilia warmingii, commonly known as the African feverfew, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf structure. The plant features basal leaves that are typically lobed or divided, with a rough, hairy texture. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces achene fruits. Aspilia warmingii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
